page.title: 06AMWELL AREA--WATER
page.content: {SQUARE 3712.} {WATER:}The New River was begun in 1609 as a canal taking the drinking water of Chadwell Springs to London. It runs into a pool with 2 islands, each with a memorial stone and one with a willow tree. Upstream and downstream are pumping stations which now contain modern machinery but which once housed huge beam pumps. {RECREATION:}Part of the area is in the Lea Valley Park. There is fishing on the River Lea, the Lea Canal and many gravel pits. This recreational use applies not only to this square but to all the others in the grid through which the rivers flow or which have gravel pits or other lakes. There is also a private estate with trout streams and pheasant shooting in its woods.
